page.title: 03SHOPPING IN HAXBY IN 1935
page.content: I interviewed two ladies from the Luncheon Club at the Methodist Chapel who shopped in Haxby in 1935. They said that the newsagents was called Bullyvans then but there has been a newsagents on that site for a hundred years.The only other shop which has stayed the same is Ellerkers the grocers. Where the travel agents is now Mrs. Jefferson used to sell flour and chicken food. The tea shop used to be a rating office and later a pork shop. Wright's Freezer shop used to be the village Post Office. Travelling salesmen sold bread and vegetables. The nearest market was in York every Saturday.
